title: WTF is that i have never seen that in league since my 6 years of playing
body:
I played 3 games since last update. 

in those 3 games, around min 5 the jungler comes bot or top when you backed and pushes until they destroy the turret. he will stay even if you come back until they get first turret. Result min. 6-9. the first turret is down and with the gold advantage the snowball begins. WTF is this. In those games, this hapenned while no lane got a real advantage on the other side...

come on wtf is this new way of playing ?

If this continues like this junglers who farm their jungle and which do ganks will be useless compared to the ones pushing.

New meta S8 : A wild jungler appeared he joins a laner or a bot lane until they get first turret and the gold. It's super effective so, if your jungler play classic clear jungle + ganks in early your team is lost.

the main problem is that :

In the past seasons even being 3 at lvl 5-6 it would take you at least 1 min to destroy a turret you'll need at least 2 waves of creeps if the tower is undamaged. Now it takes 15 secs and only one wave is suficient... You haven't the time to comeback and if you stay you'll be poked hard until you have to back... The time your jungler comes the turret is down...

And if you tell me ah this already hapenned in past seasons...

I know the difference please i am playing since s2, so i've seen a lot of things in this game (probably things that some of you had and will never see) : I have more than 5000 games played... i never made any placement game before season 5. Because they didn't really interested me. During season 6 i finally decided to invest some time to ranked games. (my elo max was Gold iv). S7 i didn't want to play a lot of ranked so i staid in silver. Finally if this continues like this i will loose all my interest in ranked games. In the past season the rankeds were intense, interesting and there was a real competition to know who would have the advantage in late game.

For what i have seen, Its not like those things already seen in league in the past... we were in lane we saw him we got under turret and he staid like 4 min in lane pushing while our jungler was ganking other lanes. He staid until they dived and we backed and they destroyed the turret. And this hapenned in the 3 games, not only in bot lane.

i know about the lane basics and advanced techniques : Freezing, when you are supposed to push and when you can back etc.  Please understand that i know all of those things.

when the jungler stays permantly in the opponents lane pushing with the botlane during 4 mins without going back to jungle or into a bush. playing like it was a 3 vs 2 and this hapenned in 3 games in a row... Those junglers stay permantly in lane pushing and poking permantly until you have to back because you and your mate are under 10% of life.... After that they get the turret. That is not how the game was played before the pre season... 

They look for the weakest of an opponent lane to make this

The great difference between past and now is that now they wont leave the lane until the first turret is down. By not leaving in mean they play the game as they were top laners, mid laner, supps or adc. They farm they push, they stay they poke and dont leave and that during 4-5min. 



...

replies.body: This "new" way of playing is Riot's answer to the problem of macro and strategy. Before, you'd have to take time to think about your next move, look for openings, contest a variety of objectives. Now you don't have to worry about that, because even a chimp could play this game. This is a good thing because reasons. If you don't like it, you are apparently in the minority (at least according to a very vocal minority, ironically). The game isn't changing any time soon. You'll need to wait for things to improve.

There's context behind that this topic ignores and other people seem to not notice. Riot has been trying tone down poke for a while but the fact simply is that the champions tailored for their "specialties" (which is ironically what runes were meant to do) created that very situation where the Xayah took so many pot shots from not knowing to dodge a skillshot and was forced out of lane from not backing sooner.

Do you nerf the poke or do you declare that the player must be more skillful and dodge the ability? These questions could be asked for many champions simply because of Comet and Aery alone. Things like Fleet Footwork and Relic Shield combo as an alternative address this ironically, and that's considered broken simply because *not everyone will do it,* not because people CAN'T do it. There are certain champs that will not adapt to this kind of meta and that's where you could argue work could be done yet again.

I'd be here all day describing the dynamics of what this game can do for balancing depending on the reasoning for why a change should be put in. Shit is harder than it looks in terms of applying something with a lasting impact.

It is likely just an emergent fact of how stupidly weak towers are currently, and Riot is already looking at a fix for the current tower problems for the next major patch cycle or two.

Now for the real post, I remember in the past for s2 to s5 that taking the tower early was a bad thing. The only turret to take early that may have been good was middle, for it gave the jungler a lot of power and pressure on the other lanes. That and mid lane is the shortest lane. But if you were top or bot and you took that turret early then congratulations you gave the opposing laner some safety to farm. You can't over extend to stop their farming, and when their creeps over extend then they can farm in the jungle. Monsters back then spawned fast enough to share. 

Sure you could go to another lane but then you're taking gold and XP from your fellow laner. You had to strategically time out when to take turrets depending on what your champion was and who your opponent's champion was. Now in comes first turret and taking turrets first matter more than strategy. Strategy and macro is gone, time to play the game like a first person shooter. (Sigh)

Why is this an issue again? This is basic macro play. It's called you got punished for taking a shitty back. If you back when the wave is pushing into you with no TP you can get punished, which you did. If you backed properly by shoving the wave out before backing you would be back to your turret before they could get free damage onto it.

This isn't an 'issue'. It's a super basic strategy that had always existed but it's just now trickling down to low ELO. People are getting better at the game. Learn basic macro or get punished. Don't take shitty backs and don't be surprised when you get punished for being forced to.

The problem is the penalty is ***wildly*** disproportionate to the *misplay*. The misplay is "didn't push out our wave" before going back, which isn't typically "Oh. Crap. We didn't think about that", rather "we got hurt in a gank, maybe even losing a kill, I  can't push the wave out like this, and it's not safe to stay". The punishment is "lose FB kill (about 600 gold),  and lose FB turret (about 750 gold), and a wave or two of minions (150 gold).

That's about a 1500 gold swing, off *an* kill in ze bot lane. When most people's net worth is still sub 2k.  And it's a common, reliable thing.

> Don't take shitty backs and don't be surprised when you get punished ***for being forced to.***


Yes, if you get forced to take a shitty back you can get punished. This isnt news. Getting forced to back when the wave is crashing at your turret is going to result in some serious tower damage and a ton of lost XP and gold. What exactly about this has changed? This has always been the case. This has always been punishable by the enemy jungler too. The difference is back in season 3 a silver jungler wouldnt have the game sense to come top and chunk the tower more with their top laner. The playerbase is getting better as more and more game knowlege is passed down over time.

On one hand, I do agree that towers are currently weak. 

On the other hand, the tactic of punishing "poor wave-management + poor recall-timing" by rushing down tower is a basic macro play which has existed long before tower first-blood was even a thing. Its increased popularity may reflect the state of the metagame, but the fact that it surprised you reflects your ignorance. 

If you have full HP and lane control and the enemy jungler still tries this, the correct response is to sit under tower and get *xp* but *not gold*. By staying in lane, the jungler will needlessly leech xp and therefore set your lane opponent enormously behind. When the tower is about to fall, simply back off and let them take it. Refusing to last-hit takes discipline. Playing classic Q-max Nasus will discipline you real fast. 

IF you are low HP and do not have lane control, you lost lane and deserve to have your tower taken. git gud.
